name: Agriculture and forestry support
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: agriculture and forestry support. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Agriculture hunting forestry and fishing
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (purchase of service/standard good/capital good) in US dollars spend on: agriculture/hunting/forestry and fishing. Factors retrieved from the Quantis+GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculator for the year 2016 and apply for years beyond 2016. The same emission factor applies to different types of investments in joint ventures/subsidiaries/associate companies that were not captured in Scope 1 emissions.

name: Cereal grains (not elsewhere specified)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: cereal grains (not specified in other EXIOBASE emission factors). Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Wood (Closed-loop source)
description: Emission intensity of wood (closed-loop source). The EF should be used to report on consumption of procured materials based on their origin (that is, comprised of primary material or recycled materials). For primary materials, these factors cover the extraction, primary processing, manufacturing and transportation materials to the point of sale, not the materials in use. For secondary materials, the factors cover sorting, processing, manufacturing and transportation to the point of sale, not the materials in use. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Wood (Open-loop source)
description: Emission intensity of wood (open-loop source). The EF should be used to report on consumption of procured materials based on their origin (that is, comprised of primary material or recycled materials). name: Real estate services
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: real estate services. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Clothing (Open-loop source)
description: Emission intensity of clothiing (open-loop source). The EF should be used to report on consumption of procured materials based on their origin (that is, comprised of primary material or recycled materials). For primary materials, these factors cover the extraction, primary processing, manufacturing and transportation materials to the point of sale, not the materials in use. For secondary materials, the factors cover sorting, processing, manufacturing and transportation to the point of sale, not the materials in use. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Retail trade (except of motor vehicles and motorcycles) and repair of personal and household goods (services)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: retail trade (except of motor vehicles and motorcycles) and repair of personal and household goods (services). Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Electricity generation  WTT
description: Emission intensity of WTT electricity generation Africa (average). Well-to-Tank (WTT) conversion factors for UK and overseas electricity should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions of extraction and refining and transportation of primary fuels before their use in the generation of electricity. It should be noted that electricity generation and transmission and distribution losses have separate WTT emissions assigned to them. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

Well-to-Tank (WTT) conversion factors for UK and overseas electricity should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions of extraction and refining and transportation of primary fuels before their use in the generation of electricity. It should be noted that electricity generation and transmission and distribution losses have separate WTT emissions assigned to them. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Nuclear plant

name: Offshore wind turbine
description: Emission intensity for offshore wind turbine. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. name: Oil steam plant
description: Emission intensity for oil steam plant. The data scope includes upstream and combustion emissions. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: Onshore wind turbine

name: Photovoltaic (Made in China)
description: Emission intensity for photovoltaic made in China. The data scope includes only upstream emissions for energy resource and the emissions related to the manufacture and maintenance of the production chain. The use of the primary energy source in itself is considered to be emission-free. If the country of production is not known the default value to be used is Photovoltaic electricity - China production. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: Grid mix (incl. biogenic CO2 factors)
description: Emission intensity of UK electricity generated as reported. Outside of scopes includes biogenic CO2 factors that should be used to account for the direct carbon dioxide (CO2) impact of burning biomass and biofuels including when reporting emissions from electricity consumption. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Transmission & distribution - UK electricity
description: Emission intensity of transmission & distribution of UK electricity as reported. These factors include only direct emissions at UK power stations and from autogenerators plus those from the proportion of imported electricity. They do not include emissions resulting from production and delivery of fuel to these power stations. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Transmission & distribution  WTT
description: Emission intensity of WTT transmission & distribution Africa (average). Well-to-Tank (WTT) conversion factors for UK and overseas electricity should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions of extraction and refining and transportation of primary fuels before their use in the generation of electricity. It should be noted that electricity generation and transmission and distribution losses have separate WTT emissions assigned to them. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

Well-to-Tank (WTT) conversion factors for UK and overseas electricity should be used to report the Scope 3 emissions of extraction and refining and transportation of primary fuels before their use in the generation of electricity. It should be noted that electricity generation and transmission and distribution losses have separate WTT emissions assigned to them. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Distribution and trade  of electricity (services)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: distribution and trade of electricity (services). Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Agricultural Byproducts
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Agricultural byproducts
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption at a facility to produce electricity/steam/heat or power. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 1 Stationary Combustion Emission Factors - March 9 2018. The CO2 factor represents the biogenic CO2 factor.

name: Aviation fuel (avgas)
description: Emission intensity of aviation gasoline. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020. Retrieved from 2020 Emission Factors Flat File.

name: Aviation gasoline
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: aviation gasoline. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade. WARNING: This factor differs substantially from similar data points and could be erroneous. It is included to retain consistency with the source.

name: Aviation Gasoline
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Aviation Gasoline
description: Emission intensity of mobile combustion of fuel in CO2 only. Note that these factors should be combined with the appropriate factors for the emission of CH4 and N20 depending on vehicle type and distance travelled to establish a total CO2-equivalent value. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Aviation gasoline - aviation gasoline aircraft
description: Emission intensity of mobile combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption by vehicles that are owned or leased by the company. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - March 9 2018 - WRI - GHG Protocol - Emission Factors from Cross-Sector Tools - April 2014.

name: Aviation Gasoline Aircraft
description: Emission intensity in CH4 and N20 of mobile combustion of fuel. Note that these factors should be combined with the appropriate factors for the emission of CO2 depending on vehicle type and distance travelled to establish a total CO2-equivalent value. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Aviation spirit
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Aviation spirit
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. name: Aviation Spirit - WTT
description: Well-to-Tank (WTT) emission intensity of fuel. WTT fuels conversion factors should be used to account for the upstream Scope 3 emissions associated with extraction and refining and transportation of the raw fuel sources to an organisation site (or asset) - prior to combustion. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Aviation Spirit - WTT
description: Well-to-Tank (WTT) emission intensity of fuel. name: Aviation Spirit - WTT (gross calorific value)
description: Well-to-Tank (WTT) emission intensity of fuel. The emission factor is calculated using the Gross Calorific Value. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Biodiesels
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: biodiesels. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

Fuels conversion factors should be used for primary fuel sources combusted at a site or in an asset owned or controlled by the reporting organisation. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Coal (industrial) - WTT
description: Well-to-Tank (WTT) emission intensity of fuel. WTT fuels conversion factors should be used to account for the upstream Scope 3 emissions associated with extraction and refining and transportation of the raw fuel sources to an organisation site (or asset) - prior to combustion. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Coal (industrial) - WTT (gross calorific value)
description: Well-to-Tank (WTT) emission intensity of fuel. WTT fuels conversion factors should be used to account for the upstream Scope 3 emissions associated with extraction and refining and transportation of the raw fuel sources to an organisation site (or asset) - prior to combustion. The emission factor is calculated using the Gross Calorific Value. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Coal tar
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: coal tar. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade. WARNING: This factor differs substantially from similar data points and could be erroneous. It is included to retain consistency with the source.

name: Diesel Agricultural Equipment
description: Emission intensity in CH4 and N20 of mobile combustion of fuel. Note that these factors should be combined with the appropriate factors for the emission of CO2 depending on vehicle type and distance travelled to establish a total CO2-equivalent value. Includes equipment such as tractors and combines as well as fuel consumption from trucks that are used off-road in agriculture. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Ethanol (100%)
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Ethanol (100%)
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Ethanol (100%)
description: Emission intensity of mobile combustion of fuel in CO2 only. Note that these factors should be combined with the appropriate factors for the emission of CH4 and N20 depending on vehicle type and distance travelled to establish a total CO2-equivalent value. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Ethanol (100%)
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption at a facility to produce electricity/steam/heat or power. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 1 Stationary Combustion Emission Factors - March 9 2018. The CO2 factor represents the biogenic CO2 factor.

name: Ethanol (100%) - ethanol light-duty vehicles
description: Emission intensity of mobile combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption by vehicles that are owned or leased by the company. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - March 9 2018 - WRI - GHG Protocol - Emission Factors from Cross-Sector Tools - April 2014. The CO2 factor represents the biogenic CO2 factor.

name: Ethanol (100%) - ethanol medium and heavy-duty vehicles
description: Emission intensity of mobile combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption by vehicles that are owned or leased by the company. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - March 9 2018 - WRI - GHG Protocol - Emission Factors from Cross-Sector Tools - April 2014. The CO2 factor represents the biogenic CO2 factor.

name: Fuel Oil - WTT
description: Well-to-Tank (WTT) emission intensity of fuel. WTT fuels conversion factors should be used to account for the upstream Scope 3 emissions associated with extraction and refining and transportation of the raw fuel sources to an organisation site (or asset) - prior to combustion. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Fuel Oil - WTT

name: Gasoline (2 stroke) Agricultural Equipment
description: Emission intensity in CH4 and N20 of mobile combustion of fuel. Note that these factors should be combined with the appropriate factors for the emission of CO2 depending on vehicle type and distance travelled to establish a total CO2-equivalent value. Includes equipment such as cranes/dumpers/excavators as well as fuel consumption from trucks that are used off-road in construction. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Landfill gas (incl. biogenic CO2 factors)

name: Lignite coal
description: Emission intensity of stationary combustion of fuel. Includes fuel consumption at a facility to produce electricity/steam/heat or power. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 1 Stationary Combustion Emission Factors - March 9 2018.

name: Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG)
description: Emission intensity of mobile combustion of fuel in CO2 only. Note that these factors should be combined with the appropriate factors for the emission of CH4 and N20 depending on vehicle type and distance travelled to establish a total CO2-equivalent value. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

name: Liquefied petroleum gases
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: liquefied petroleum gases. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: LNG - WTT
description: Well-to-Tank (WTT) emission intensity of fuel. name: LNG - WTT

name: LNG - WTT (gross calorific value)

description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: refinery feedstocks. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Steam and hot water supply (services)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: steam and hot water supply (services). Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Batteries - Alkaline (Primary material production)
description: Emission intensity of batteries - Alkaline (primary material production). The EF should be used to report on consumption of procured materials based on their origin (that is, comprised of primary material or recycled materials). For primary materials, these factors cover the extraction, primary processing, manufacturing and transportation materials to the point of sale, not the materials in use. For secondary materials, the factors cover sorting, processing, manufacturing and transportation to the point of sale, not the materials in use. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Post and telecommunication
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: post and telecommunication. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Aggregates (Closed-loop source)
description: Emission intensity of aggregates (closed-loop source). The EF should be used to report on consumption of procured materials based on their origin (that is, comprised of primary material or recycled materials). For primary materials, these factors cover the extraction, primary processing, manufacturing and transportation materials to the point of sale, not the materials in use. For secondary materials, the factors cover sorting, processing, manufacturing and transportation to the point of sale, not the materials in use. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

For secondary materials, the factors cover sorting, processing, manufacturing and transportation to the point of sale, not the materials in use. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Plastics/basic
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: plastics/basic. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: PP (incl. forming) (Closed-loop source)
description: Emission intensity of PP (incl. forming) (closed-loop source). The EF should be used to report on consumption of procured materials based on their origin (that is, comprised of primary material or recycled materials). For primary materials, these factors cover the extraction, primary processing, manufacturing and transportation materials to the point of sale, not the materials in use. For secondary materials, the factors cover sorting, processing, manufacturing and transportation to the point of sale, not the materials in use. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Hotels and campgrounds
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: hotels and campgrounds. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: All other food and drinking places
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: all other food and drinking places. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Food and beverages services (dine in and takeaway)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: restaurant and cafe meals/ alcoholic beverages/ takeaway meals/ hot food and cold food/ confectionery/ ice cream/ soft drink/ contract catering/ school meals/ meals bought in workplace. In actual prices in s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Full-service restaurants
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: full-service restaurants. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Limited-service restaurants
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: limited-service restaurants. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Hotel and restaurant (services)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: hotel and restaurant (services). Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Hotel and restaurant (services)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: hotel and restaurant (services). Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Hotel and restaurant (services)
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: hotel and restaurant (services). Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Hotels and restaurants
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (purchase of service/standard good/capital good) in US dollars spend on: hotels and restaurants. Factors retrieved from the Quantis+GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculator for the year 2016 and apply for years beyond 2016. The same emission factor applies to different types of investments in joint ventures/subsidiaries/associate companies that were not captured in Scope 1 emissions.

name: Air freight - RF effect unknown
description: Emission intensity of third-party transport in US dollars spend on: air freight. Factors retrieved from the Quantis+GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculator for the year 2016 and apply for years beyond 2016. NOTE: It is unknown if the radiative forcing (RF) effect that reflects the impact of contrails and high-altitude release of GHGs is included.

name: Air freight - RF effect unknown
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: air transport/freight. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors. NOTE: It is unknown if the radiative forcing (RF) effect that reflects the impact of contrails and high-altitude release of GHGs is included.

name: Air freight outside UK - with RF effect
description: Emission intensity of international freight flight (to/from non-UK countries) including emissions from combustion and radiative forcing (RF) effect reflecting impact of contrails and high-altitude release of GHGs but not upstream fuel emissions. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Air transport - RF effect unknown
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (purchase of service/standard good/capital good) in US dollars spend on: air transport. Factors retrieved from the Quantis+GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculator for the year 2016 and apply for years beyond 2016. The same emission factor applies to different types of investments in joint ventures/subsidiaries/associate companies that were not captured in Scope 1 emissions. NOTE: It is unknown if the radiative forcing (RF) effect that reflects the impact of contrails and high-altitude release of GHGs is included.

name: Aircraft - RF effect unknown
description: Emission intensity of aircraft. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 8 Business Travel and Employee Commuting - March 9 2018. name: Rail freight train
description: Emission intensity of goods transported by rail freight transport. Based on a mixture of emissions from diesel and electricity generation. name: Rail transport

name: Truck transport
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: truck transport. name: Automobile

The same emission factor applies to different types of investments in joint ventures/subsidiaries/associate companies that were not captured in Scope 1 emissions.

name: Ferry (average per passenger)

name: Sea travel

name: Bus and coach fares

name: Diesel vans - average (up to 3.5 tonnes)
description: Emission intensity of average diesel vans (up to 3.5 tonnes). The primary source is UK DEFRA Freighting goods 2019. WARNING: This emission factor has not passed our data validation process as the primary source reports the CH4 and N2O values in kg but the GHG protocol reports them in grams. We have included this for completeness to retain consistency with the source.

name: Diesel vehicle (1350-1600cc) post-2015
description: Emission intensity of diesel vehicle between 1350 and 1600 cc. Post-2015 fleet. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020. Retrieved from 2020 Emission Factors Flat File.

name: E85 car
description: Emission intensity of passenger car fueled by ethanol fuel blend of 85% ethanol fuel and 15% petrol. Provided by the HBEFA & Yearly Compte des Transports. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: Ethanol Buses
description: Emission intensity in CH4 and N20 of mobile combustion of fuel per mile. Note that these factors should be combined with the appropriate factors for the emission of CO2 per-gallon depending on vehicle type and fuel consumed to establish a total CO2-equivalent value. Retrieved from the GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx) file published by the US EPA at the source URL.

This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Motor vehicles/trailers and semitrailers
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: motor vehicles/trailers and semitrailers. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Motor vehicles/trailers and semitrailers
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: motor vehicles/trailers and semitrailers. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Motor vehicles/trailers and semitrailers
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: motor vehicles/trailers and semitrailers. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Motorbike
description: Emission intensity of motorbike. The primary source is UK DEFRA Passenger vehicles 2019. WARNING: This emission factor has not passed our data validation process as the primary source reports the CH4 and N2O values in kg but the GHG protocol reports them in grams. We have included this for completeness to retain consistency with the source.

name: Motorcycle
description: Emission intensity of motorcycle. Retrieved from the EPA's GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx).

name: Motorcycle
description: Emission intensity of motorcycle. The primary source is EPA Emission Factors for Greenhouse Gas Inventories - Table 8 Business Travel and Employee Commuting - March 9 2018.

name: Motorcycles/bicycle/other purchase
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: outright purchase of new or secondhand motorcycles/bicycles/other. In actual prices in s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: PHEV car (supermini) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for supermini PHEV car. This is a car that is larger than a city car but smaller than a small family car. Examples include: Ford Fiesta Renault CLIO Volkswagen Polo Citron C2 and C3 Opel Corsa Peugeot 208 and Toyota Yaris. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: PHEV car (upper medium) - electricity consumption
description: Emission intensity of electricity generation for upper medium PHEV car. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. This is classed as a large family car. Examples include: BMW 3 Series KODA Octavia Volkswagen Passat Audi A4 Mercedes Benz C Class and Peugeot 508. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: PHEV light vehicle with auxiliary power unit
description: Emission intensity of plug-in hybrid with auxiliary power unit light vehicle (segment A). Provided by the HBEFA & Yearly Compte des Transports. Retrieved from Base Carbone - Data V21.0.csv.

name: Pickup trucks/vans and SUVs
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: pickup trucks/vans and suvs. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Railroad rolling stock
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: railroad rolling stock. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Sale/maintenance/repair/parts/accessories of motor vehicles/motorcycles
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: sale/maintenance/repair/parts/accessories of motor vehicles/motorcycle. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Sale/maintenance/repair/parts/accessories of motor vehicles/motorcycles
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: sale/maintenance/repair/parts/accessories of motor vehicles/motorcycle. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Sale/maintenance/repair/parts/accessories of motor vehicles/motorcycles
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: sale/maintenance/repair/parts/accessories of motor vehicles/motorcycle. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Ships and ship repair
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: ships and ship repair. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Taxi (average)
description: Emission intensity of regular taxi. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Taxi (average) post-2015
description: Emission intensity of average taxi by distance travelled. Default factor. No upstream or downstream LCA activity is included. Published by the Ministry for the Environment of New Zealand in 2020. Retrieved from 2020 Emission Factors Flat File.

name: Truck trailers
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: truck trailers. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Vans - average (up to 3.5 tonnes)
description: Emission intensity of average vans (up to 3.5 tonnes). The primary source is UK DEFRA Freighting goods 2019. WARNING: This emission factor has not passed our data validation process as the primary source reports the CH4 and N2O values in kg but the GHG protocol reports them in grams. We have included this for completeness to retain consistency with the source.

name: Vehicle purchase
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in GBP spend on: new/secondhand cars/vans outright purchase/hire lease. In actual prices in s and including VAT. Provided by BEIS/DEFRA in the official report on GHG Emissions of the UK between 1996-2018. Where source emission factors are identical across a variety of activities they have been grouped to avoid confusion - details are documented in the OEFDB data guidance.

name: Vehicle rental and leasing
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: vehicle rental and leasing. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Warehousing
description: Emission intensity of third-party distribution in US dollars spend on: warehousing. Factors retrieved from the Quantis+GHG Protocol Scope 3 Calculator for the year 2016 and apply for years beyond 2016.

name: Warehousing
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: warehousing. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

Landfilling emissions include transport to landfill/equipment use at landfill and fugitive landfill CH4 emissions. Landfill CH4 is based on typical landfill gas collection practices and average landfill moisture conditions. Retrieved from the EPA's GHG Emission Factors Hub (xlsx).

name: Food waste for treatment: biogasification and land application
description: Emission intensity of supply chain in EUR spend on: food waste for treatment: biogasification and land application. Retrieved from the EXIOBASE v3 model outputs for products. These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

These factors were calculated based on 2019 data. CO2 equivalent factors incorporate emissions from land use; constituent gases have not been included as they do not. The LCA boundaries of these factors are not defined by the source. These factors include effects of international trade.

name: Water supply
description: Emission intensity for water supply. Based on emissions associated with offices/transport/treatment of water supply. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.

name: Drinking water and wastewater treatment
description: Emission intensity of supply chain (with margins i.e. cradle to shelf) in US dollars spend on: drinking water and wastewater treatment. This factor is representative of the described commodity (equivalent to a goods or services category) and was calculated from 2016 data applying IPCC 4th Assessment Report conversion factors.

name: Water treatment
description: Emission intensity of water treatment in the UK in 2021. Based on emissions associated with offices/transport/treatment of wastewater. Retrieved from the Conversion Factors 2021: flat file published by the UK BEIS/Defra at the source URL.
